newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures end lower, seen soft.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures end lower, seen soft.

text.p: Rubber futures finished lower on Friday on the back of lower prices in Japan with the market seen slipping next week because of ample supplies in the market, dealers said.
"Normally, we'll see some shortcovering in Japan ahead of the weekend, but the fall this afternoon is so disheartening and pulled the market lower," a local rubber trader said.
"There was some light buying by local dealers, but it was not enough to lift the market and it finished weakly this afternoon," another dealer said.
Dealers said prices will slide next week if the good weather holds in Thailand and Malaysia, boosting the availability of supplies.
At around 0945 GMT, December RSS3 was seen at 124.50 U.S. cents a kg from 125.25 cents.
December RSS1 was seen at 177.75 Singapore cents (US$1.26) a kg from the previous 178.00 cents.
December TSR20 was seen at 172.00 Singapore cents (US$1.22) a kg against the previous 173.25 cents.
